item.title: How i can fix this
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[code=Java] public void giveItems() {
client other = getClient(trade_reqId);
if (validClient(trade_reqId)) {
try {
for (GameItem item : other.offeredItems) {
if (item.id > 0) {
addItem2(item.id, item.amount);
// println(“TradeConfirmed, item=”+item.id);
BufferedWriter bwww = null;

					try {
						bwww = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(
								"logs/trades.txt", true));
						bwww.write(other.playerName + " trades: "
								+ item.amount + " " + getItemName(item.id)
								+ "(s) ( ID = " + item.id + " ) with : "
								+ playerName);
						bwww.newLine();
						bwww.flush();
					} catch (IOException ioe) {
						ioe.printStackTrace();
					} finally {
						if (bwww != null) {
							try {
								bwww.close();
							} catch (IOException ioe2) {
								sM("Error logging trade!");
							}
						}
					}
				}
			}
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}
}[/code]

You can’t have try without catch/finally.

Read full topic

item.title: How i can fix this
item.dc:creator: @ameer122 ameer122
item.description:
@ameer122 wrote:

i added this

[code=java] public void giveItems() {
client other = getClient(trade_reqId);
if (validClient(trade_reqId)) {
try {
for (GameItem item: other.offeredItems) {
if (item.id > 0) {
addItem2(item.id, item.amount);
//println(“TradeConfirmed, item=”+item.id);
BufferedWriter bwww = null;

    try {
        bwww = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/trades.txt", true));
                    bwww.write( other.playerName+ " trades: " +item.amount+ " " +getItemName(item.id)+ "(s) ( ID = " +item.id+ " ) with : "             
                                    + playerName);
                    bwww.newLine();
                    bwww.flush();
                } catch (IOException ioe) {
                    ioe.printStackTrace();
                } finally {
                    if (bwww != null) {
                        try {
                            bwww.close();
                        } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                            sM("Error logging trade!");
                        }
                    }
                }
				}
				}
				}
				}
				}[/code]
